siphon.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a bent tube used for getting liquid out of a container, used by holding one end of the tube at a lower level than the end in the container
siphon.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a type of bottle for holding soda water, which is forced out of the bottle using gas pressure
siphon.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to remove liquid from a container by using a siphon
siphon.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: It took him only a few minutes to siphon off the petrol and drive away.
Crews began siphoning oil from the leaking boat.
siphon.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to dishonestly take money from a business, account etc to use it for a purpose for which it was not intended
siphon.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Emergency aid was siphoned off by foreign ministry officials for their own use.
I found she had siphoned thousands of dollars from our bank account.
siphon.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to dishonestly take money from a business, account etc and use it for a purpose for which it was not intended
siphon.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: I later found she had siphoned thousands of dollars from our bank account.
Corrupt officials had been siphoning off public funds for private business ventures.
